meanings.definition: The state or quality of being low in position or condition.
meanings.sent1: The lownesses of the valley made it difficult for sunlight to reach the bottom.
meanings.sent2: She felt the lownesses of her spirits after the disappointing news.
meanings.sent3: The lownesses of the table made it perfect for playing hide and seek.
meanings.sent4: The lownesses of the student's grades were a cause for concern.
meanings.sent5: The lownesses of the cave created a sense of mystery and adventure.

meanings.definition: The quality of being low in rank or importance.
meanings.sent1: The lownesses of the employees in the company were often overlooked.
meanings.sent2: He was frustrated by the lownesses of his role in the project.
meanings.sent3: The lownesses of the ants in the insect hierarchy led to a comical mix-up.
meanings.sent4: The lownesses of the pawn in chess can sometimes surprise the opponent.
meanings.sent5: The lownesses of the background characters added depth to the story.
